text: Maurice de Bus (30 December 1907 - 11 November 1963) was a French sculptor. He graduated from the École nationale supérieure des Beaux-Arts. He won the Prix de Rome in Sculpture in 1937. He lived at the Villa Medici in 1938-1939. He also designed coins for the Monnaie de Paris. ==References== Category:1907 births Category:1963 deaths Category:People from Seine-et-Marne Category:Alumni of the École des Beaux-Arts Category:French male sculptors Category:20th-century French sculptors Category:Prix de Rome winners
title: Maurice de Bus
